advertisement.title: Advertisement & Marketing
advertisement.intro: We do not display commercial ads. Our platform is devoted solely to scholarly communication.
advertisement.details: Instead of banner ads, we focus on selective outreach—personally inviting researchers whose expertise fits the journal. Every call-for-paper email is concise, transparent and contains a one-click opt-out. We never sell contact data and strictly follow GDPR, COPE and best-practice marketing ethics to maintain community trust.

points.noAds: Zero third-party adverts or paid banners
points.targetedInvites: Invitations sent only to relevant scholars
points.optOut: Clear opt-out link in every email
points.dataPrivacy: No sharing or selling of personal data
points.scopeAlignment: Promotions limited to journal’s scientific scope

cooperation.title: Institutional Cooperations
cooperation.description: We proudly collaborate with regional and international institutions committed to sustainability, education, and scientific advancement. These partnerships amplify our outreach, foster joint research, and encourage knowledge sharing across borders.

cycere.title: Cyprus Centre for Environmental Research and Education (CYCERE)
cycere.text: Located on the Akrotiri Peninsula, CYCERE is the first independent environmental center in Cyprus. It supports conservation through environmental education, research, and outreach.

cbs.title: Cyprus Biological Society (CBS)
cbs.text: CBS is dedicated to advancing biology in Cyprus through research, education, and public engagement in biological sciences.

impact.sustainability: Support for global environmental sustainability goals

history.title: Journal History
history.intro: The journal has undergone significant evolution since its establishment. Through rebranding and editorial enhancement, it has adapted to the modern academic landscape while maintaining high standards of quality and ethics.
history.currentName: Interdisciplinary Journal of Environmental and Science Education (since Volume 15 Issue 1, 2019)
history.formerName: International Journal of Environmental Science Education (Volume 1 Issue 1, 2006 – Volume 14 Issue 9, 2019)
history.additional: Over time, the journal has experienced milestones that have shaped its identity:

addPoints.rebranding: A strategic rebranding to emphasize interdisciplinary research
addPoints.editorialGrowth: Strengthening of editorial board and peer-review processes
addPoints.globalReach: Increased visibility and accessibility to a global audience
addPoints.digitalIndexing: Integration into major indexing and archiving platforms

timeline.title: Key Milestones
timeline.founded: Journal launched as International Journal of Environmental Science Education.
timeline.openAccess: Adopted full open access publishing model.
timeline.renamed: Renamed to reflect broader interdisciplinary scope.
timeline.indexing: Achieved indexing in international scientific databases.

archiving.title: Archiving Policy
archiving.intro: To guarantee permanent access, we combine trusted third-party preservation with author-driven self-archiving.
archiving.details: Scientific knowledge must outlive shifting technologies and corporate lifecycles. Our multi-layered preservation strategy ensures every article remains discoverable, citable, and intact for future generations of researchers. By partnering with Portico, maintaining redundant off-site backups, and exposing rich metadata through OAI-PMH, we safeguard the scholarly record against digital decay.

points.portico: Locked archival masters preserved by Portico
points.selfArchive: Authors may deposit the final PDF in any OAI-compliant repository
points.redundancy: Geo-distributed back-ups and mirrored data centers
points.versioning: All versions stored with clear DOI-linked provenance
points.recovery: Disaster-recovery plan with regular restoration drills

hero.title: Discover. Understand.
hero.description: Where science education meets real-world impact. Join us on a mission to build a smarter, greener tomorrow.

history.title: Publication History
history.current: Interdisciplinary Journal of Environmental and Science Education (Volume 15 Issue 1, 2019 - current)
history.former: International Journal of Environmental and Science Education with ISSN 1306-3065 (Volume 1 Issue 1, 2006 - Volume 14 Issue 9, 2019)
history.note: Starting Volume 19 Issue 1 (2023), the journal is published by Modestum.

journal1.title: Interdisciplinary Journal of Environmental and Science Education
journal1.description1: The Interdisciplinary Journal of Environmental and Science Education (ISSN: 2633-6537) publishes original research articles from throughout the world in the fields of sciences education and environmental education.
journal1.description2: IJESE adopts an Open Access policy complying with the definition laid out by the Budapest Open Access Initiative (BOAI) and is published quarterly by Modestum DOO, Serbia. All published manuscripts apply the Terms and conditions of Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.
journal1.openAccessText: Following the Budapest Open Access Initiative (BOAI) for maximum visibility and impact.
journal1.cooperationText: In partnership with the Cyprus Centre for Environmental Research and Education (CYCERE).

footer.description: Medical Research Journal publishes peer-reviewed open-access journals for the scientific community worldwide.

aimsHero.title: Aims & Scope
aimsHero.p1: The Interdisciplinary Journal of Environmental and Science Education (IJESE) publishes original, double‑blind peer‑reviewed articles from around the world in the fields of science and environmental education. We aim to provide scholars with a premier venue to share transformative ideas and evidence‑based practices.
aimsHero.p2: IJESE welcomes systematic reviews, meta‑analyses, empirical and theoretical studies, essays, commentaries, and case studies that advance scholarly understanding and promote sustainability‑oriented education.

about.title: About the Journal
about.description1: The Interdisciplinary Journal of Environmental and Science Education (IJESE) publishes original research from around the world in the fields of Science Education and Environmental Education.
about.description2: IJESE is an Open Access journal. Articles are published under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license (CC BY 4.0), which allows use, redistribution, remixing, and commercial reuse with proper citation.
about.license: All content is licensed under Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0).

login.resetPasswordSubtitle: Enter your email to receive instructions

indexing.title: Indexing and Abstracting
indexing.subtitle: Our journal is indexed by several leading scientific platforms, ensuring global visibility and citation tracking.

descriptions.googleScholar: Broad access through Google’s academic search engine.
descriptions.crossref: Official DOI registration for all published articles.
descriptions.scilit: Scientific literature database with dynamic indexing.
descriptions.doaj: Directory of Open Access Journals ensuring transparency.

openAccess.title: Open Access Policy
openAccess.description: This is an open access journal. All content is freely available without charge to the user or their institution and without any embargo period.

points.boai: Complies with the BOAI definition of open access
points.license: Published under Creative Commons Attribution License (CC BY 4.0)
points.archive: Authors may self-archive their articles in open repositories
points.immediate: Immediate access with no subscription or fees
points.global: Accessible by researchers and readers worldwide
points.equity: Fosters equity by removing barriers to knowledge
points.educationSupport: Supports educators and students with free material
points.responsibleReuse: Encourages responsible reuse with proper credit
points.openCommunity: Builds a global open-access research community

copyright.title: Copyright and Licensing
copyright.description: Articles are published under the Creative Commons Attribution License. Authors retain ownership and grant us a license to publish.

points.ownership: Authors retain copyright ownership of their work
points.permissions: No copyrighted material may be used without permission
points.attribution: Users must credit authors and cite the original publication
points.ccLicense: All content distributed under CC BY 4.0
points.reuseAllowed: Anyone may copy, adapt, and share with attribution

factsDescription: We bring together research, clinics, and technologies to improve health globally.
articlesDescription: A complete list of fresh peer-reviewed research.

sections.heading: Authorship
sections.text: Authors must significantly contribute to the study’s concept, data collection, analysis, and interpretation, and approve the final manuscript...

sections.heading: Competing Interests
sections.text: Authors must disclose financial, personal, or other conflicts that could bias their work...

sections.heading: Funding
sections.text: All funding sources, including grant numbers, must be reported...

sections.heading: Research on Live Subjects
sections.text: Compliance with ethical guidelines (e.g., WMA Declaration of Helsinki) is mandatory...

sections.heading: Informed Consent
sections.text: Authors must obtain and confirm participant consents...

sections.heading: Vulnerable Groups
sections.text: Studies involving vulnerable populations must justify their inclusion...

sections.heading: Confidential Data
sections.text: Authors must protect sensitive data and ensure participant safety.

sections.heading: Data Sharing
sections.text: Articles should state data availability, access procedures, and duration...

sections.heading: Intellectual Property
sections.text: Authors must secure permissions for copyrighted...

sections.heading: Ethical Oversight
sections.text: All parties must follow COPE’s ethical guidelines...

sections.heading: Corrections and Retractions
sections.text: Errors in published articles are corrected with notices...

sections.heading: Complaints and Appeals
sections.text: Authors may address concerns to editor@modestum.co.uk...

sections.heading: Roles and Responsibilities
sections.text:
Authors: Submit original work, disclose conflicts...
Reviewers: Maintain confidentiality, review fairly...
Editors: Unbiased peer review...
Publisher: Provides tools and ensures independence.

sections.heading: Plagiarism and Malpractice Policy
sections.text:
Authors must avoid plagiarism, simultaneous submissions...
Misconduct triggers COPE-guided investigations.

editorialPolicy.title: Editorial Policy
editorialPolicy.languageDescription: Authors must ensure that their submission is free of linguistic errors and complies with the journal's formatting standards.
editorialPolicy.editingDescription: Non-native English speakers are encouraged to use language editing services to improve grammar, clarity, and formatting before submission.
editorialPolicy.ethicsDescription: Submitted work must be original, unpublished, and prepared in accordance with ethical standards. All co-authors must approve.
editorialPolicy.dualSubmissionDescription: Manuscripts must not be under review elsewhere. Submissions violating this will be rejected immediately.
editorialPolicy.peerReviewDescription: All submissions go through an initial editorial check, then double-blind peer review. Revisions may be requested at any time.
editorialPolicy.submissionIDDescription: Each submission receives a unique ID, which should be used in all correspondence with editors and support staff.

submission.title: Manuscript Submission
submission.text1: All manuscripts must be submitted in English via the
submission.text2: Submissions should be original, unpublished, and aligned with the journal’s scope and ethics. Authors must enter co-author information and ensure consistency in language style.

preparation.title: Manuscript Preparation
preparation.text: Format your manuscript using A4 size, 1.5 line spacing, 11-12 pt fonts, justified text. Submit two files: a title page (with author info, contributions, funding) and a blinded manuscript (no author details). Structure: Title, Abstract (≤150 words), Keywords, Introduction, Methods, Results, Discussion, Conclusions, References.

references.title: References & Citations
references.text: Follow APA 7th edition. Include all cited works in the reference list. Use 'et al.' for 3+ authors in text. Direct quotes should include page numbers. Avoid op. cit. and ibid.

figures.title: Figures & Tables
figures.text: Tables must be self-explanatory with concise captions. Figures should be high-resolution (JPEG, 300 dpi), labeled (a, b, c...), and uploaded separately. Indicate placement with [Table 1], [Figure 1] in text.

final.title: Final Checks & Contact
final.text1: Ensure clarity, originality, proper citations, valid methodology, and that all authors are added to the portal. Contact us for technical support at

peerReview.title: Peer Review Policy
peerReview.doubleBlindDesc: Both authors and reviewers remain anonymous to ensure unbiased evaluation.
peerReview.reviewPurposeDesc: The review process ensures the quality and integrity of published content.
peerReview.reviewProcessDesc: Manuscripts are reviewed by at least two independent experts.
peerReview.competingDesc: Reviewers must disclose any potential conflicts of interest.
peerReview.confidentialityDesc: All submitted materials are kept confidential during the review.
peerReview.timelinessDesc: Reviewers are expected to submit evaluations within the specified timeframe.
peerReview.recommendationsDesc: Reviewers suggest acceptance, revision, or rejection based on merit.
peerReview.reportFormatDesc: Feedback should be constructive, clear, and well-structured.

contact.title: Get in <1>touch</1>
contact.description: We are always ready to assist you, answer your questions, and help you schedule an appointment. Fill out the form or use a convenient way to contact us.
contact.name: Name

appointment.title: Schedule Appointment
appointment.description: Call to schedule a consultation with a specialist. We will find the most convenient time for you.

location.title: Our Location
location.description: 100 Amir Temur Avenue, Tashkent, Uzbekistan. We are waiting for you.

partnership.title: Partnership
partnership.description: We are always open to new ideas and collaborations. Email us.

emergency.title: Emergency
emergency.description: For life-threatening situations, call immediately. We are available 24/7.

articleFee.title: Article Processing Fee (APF)
articleFee.description: Modestum publishes all its journals as Open Access. This means all articles are made available to readers worldwide free of charge. To support this, a one-time Article Processing Fee (APF) is required upon article acceptance, covering peer review, production, hosting, and distribution costs.
articleFee.note1: Type I: Original Research, Review Articles
articleFee.note2: Type II: Case Reports, Short Communications, etc.

cookie.title: We use cookies 🍪
cookie.description: To improve the portal experience, for analytics, and content personalization.

general.title: General Terms
general.text: These terms govern your use of our services and website. By using the site, you agree to these terms.

intellectual.title: Intellectual Property
intellectual.text: All content is protected by copyright. You may not use, reproduce or distribute it without permission.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.text: We make no warranties about the accuracy or completeness of the site’s content.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Content
thirdParty.text: We are not responsible for third-party websites linked from our site.

offensive.title: Offensive Material
offensive.text: Users must not upload or distribute offensive, illegal, or harmful content.

payments.title: Payments
payments.text: All payments are processed securely. Additional terms may apply to certain services.

exchange.title: Exchanges and Returns
exchange.text: We accept returns under specific conditions. Please read our return policy for details.

vat.title: VAT and Fees
vat.text: Prices may include applicable VAT and other taxes depending on your location.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.text: Your data is protected according to our Privacy Policy, which you should read carefully.

reclamation.title: Reclamations
reclamation.text: Users may file complaints through our official contact channels.

refund.title: Refund Policy
refund.text: Refunds are available under certain conditions. See our refund policy.

complaints.title: Complaints and Disputes
complaints.text: We aim to resolve complaints fairly and transparently. Contact us for any disputes.

modifications.title: Modifications to Terms
modifications.text: We may change these terms at any time. Continued use means you accept the changes.

personal.title: Personal Information
personal.text: We collect personal details such as your name, email address, institutional affiliation, country, academic degree, and researcher identifiers like ORCID.

use.title: Use of Information
use.text: Your information is used to facilitate editorial workflows, communicate with authors and reviewers, process payments, and ensure legal compliance.

store.title: Data Storage
store.text: We retain personal data only for as long as necessary and rely on secure third-party services for storage and processing.

sharing.title: Data Sharing
sharing.text: We do not sell your information. Data may be shared with editors, reviewers, DOI services, plagiarism checkers, and payment processors as needed.

links.title: Third-Party Links
links.text: Our site may include links to external websites. We are not responsible for their privacy practices or content.

children.title: Children
children.text: Our services are intended for users over the age of 18. Children under 13 should not use this site without parental consent.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.text: We use cookies and similar technologies to enhance your experience. For details, see our Cookies Policy.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.text: You have the right to access, correct, delete, or restrict the processing of your personal data at any time.

changes.title: Policy Changes
changes.text: This policy may be updated occasionally. Any changes will be posted on this page.

contact.title: Contact
contact.text: For privacy-related inquiries, contact Mr. Tim Haider at info@modestum.org.

cookie_policy.title: Cookie Policy
cookie_policy.text: We are committed to being transparent about the technologies and information used across our Sites. Please review this Cookie Policy, along with our Privacy Policy and Terms of Use before using the Sites.

cookie_def.title: What are cookies
cookie_def.text: Cookies are small text files stored on your device by your browser during website visits. They improve user experience, remember login details, and help monitor how the site is used.

cookie_types.title: Types of cookies
cookie_types.text: Some cookies are session-based (temporary) and deleted after your browser session ends. Others are persistent and remain between sessions.

cookie_use.title: Cookies that we use
cookie_use.text: We use only temporary session cookies for statistical purposes. These cookies do not store personally identifiable information.

cookie_manage.title: Managing your cookie preferences
cookie_manage.text: You may disable cookies via your browser settings. However, since we only use essential cookies, disabling them may affect some site functionality.

cookie_changes.title: Changes to this policy
cookie_changes.text: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time. Changes will be posted on this page. Please read it carefully before using our Sites.

cookie_contact.title: Contact us
cookie_contact.text: If you have questions or requests about this Cookie Policy, contact Mr. Tim Heider at: info@modestum.org.

cookie_policy.title: Cookie Policy
cookie_policy.text: At Modestum (“Modestum”, “we”, “us” or “our”), we are committed to being transparent about the technologies and information that are used in this site and affiliated journal websites (collectively, "Sites"). Please read this cookie policy, as well as our “Privacy policy” and our “Terms of use” before using the sites.

cookie_def.title: What are Cookies
cookie_def.text: Cookies are small text files that may be stored on your computer by the browser during your visit to the website. Most current websites use multiple cookies for various reasons, such as improving your user experience, distinguishing you from other users, remembering your login details, monitoring how you use the website, or web analytics.

cookie_types.title: Types of Cookies
cookie_types.text: Some of these cookies are session cookies, which are stored only temporarily during the current browser session. They are deleted once the browser session expires. Others are persistent cookies, which are stored between browser sessions.

cookie_use.title: Cookies We Use
cookie_use.text: We only use temporary session cookies that are used to compile statistical usage data. They do not store any personally identifiable information.

cookie_manage.title: Manage Cookie Preferences
cookie_manage.text: You may opt out of cookies through your browser settings. Please note that since we only use strictly necessary cookies, some parts of the websites may not work if you disable them.

cookie_changes.title: Changes to Cookie Policy
cookie_changes.text: This policy may be updated from time to time and any change will be immediately posted on this page. You should read and understand the contents of this policy before using our websites, products and services.

cookie_contact.title: Contact
cookie_contact.text: Questions, comments or requests about this policy should be addressed to Mr. Tim Heider at: info@modestum.org.

summary_research: Here's a summary of your current research.
projects_overview: Here is an overview of all your current and completed research projects.
project_description_crispr: Development of improved genome editing methods using new RNA guides.
project_description_microbiome: Investigation of the diversity and functions of microbial communities in soil samples.
project_description_nanoparticles: Synthesis and testing of lipid nanoparticles for targeted delivery of anti-cancer drugs.
project_description_gene_expression: Study of changes in gene expression patterns in plants under drought conditions.

event_crispr_description: Discussing the progress and next steps for the CRISPR-CAS9 project.
event_safety_description: Mandatory annual safety training for all lab personnel.
event_conference_description: Keynote speeches and poster presentations on latest biotech innovations.
publications_overview_description: Browse and manage your academic publications and research papers.
publication_gene_editing_title: Advanced Gene Editing Techniques for Precision Medicine
publication_soil_microbes_title: Ecological Dynamics of Soil Microbial Communities in Arid Zones
publication_nanoparticle_delivery_title: Novel Nanoparticle Systems for Targeted Drug Delivery in Oncology
settings_overview_description: Manage your profile, security, and application preferences.
welcome_to_lab_app: Welcome to the Lab Management App!
experiments_overview_description: Explore and manage all your scientific experiments here. Use the search and filter options to quickly find what you need.
no_experiments_found: No experiments match your criteria. Try adjusting your search or filters.

exp_004_details: Analysis of genetic variations in viral samples.
exp_005_details: Study of enzyme activity under varying conditions.
exp_006_details: Quantitative analysis of gene expression levels.
exp_007_details: Purification of recombinant proteins for structural studies.
exp_008_details: Quantitative PCR for viral load measurement.
exp_009_details: Testing cell viability under drug exposure.
exp_010_details: Synthesis of novel biomaterials for medical applications.
exp_013_details: Analysis of bacterial growth under stress conditions.
exp_014_details: Development of a pipeline for genomic data analysis.
exp_015_details: Development of a rapid diagnostic test for pathogens.
exp_016_details: Study of microbial diversity in soil samples.
exp_017_details: Testing crop resistance to environmental stressors.
exp_018_details: Analysis of signaling pathways in cancer cells.
